content.description:
Up the ridge. 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
content.protection:
Details unknown. 

  For ideas about how to set up Top-Rope see the Area page for this sector 8 Navy Patrol. 

mountainproject.com/area/11…
content.location:
At the base of the ridge forming the lower left end of the upper right rock of this sector. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Starting with your hands above a chest-height roof, work your way up a crack with a little tree growing from the middle. I found it easier to climb to the right of the tree, which is worth noting if throwing a top-rope.

 Route (A.) in mountainproject.com/photo/1…
content.protection: Anchor from trees above with 30ft+ static line. Think carefully about which side of the crack tree you want to throw your rope. I prefer climber's right.

content.description:
Short routes on rocks with slanted base. 

  Known routes as of 2017 range from 5.3 to 5.11 and include ...   .-. Black Smile   .-. Initiate   .-. Novice   .-. Parade of Wooks   .-. The Rookie 

warning: Loose rock is still a concern here. Belayer or other members of party should not stand anywhere near underneath the climber.
